questions.sentence: The lawyer asked the witness to _____ her testimony with physical evidence from the crime scene.
Security camera footage helped _____ the employee's account of what happened during the robbery.
The defense attorney used DNA evidence to _____ the prosecution's theory of the crime.
Environmental groups continue to _____ for stronger regulations on industrial pollution.
Investigators will _____ the company's financial records for any signs of fraud.

questions.definition: has subtle differences, not black and white
questions.sentence: The judge's ruling reflected a _____ understanding of constitutional law that acknowledged competing interests.
The contract's _____ wording led both parties to interpret their obligations differently.
During the exit interview, the departing employee gave a _____ assessment of the company's management problems.
The mayor took a _____ approach to homelessness, prioritizing immediate shelter over long-term policy debates.
The architect's _____ attention to structural details prevented costly errors during construction.

questions.definition: combine separate ideas into a whole
questions.sentence: The historian had to _____ information from multiple conflicting accounts to reconstruct what actually happened.

questions.definition: make something clear by explaining it
questions.sentence: The economist used several charts to _____ the relationship between inflation and unemployment.
It took years of experience before the art dealer could _____ authentic Renaissance paintings from skilled reproductions.

questions.definition: extend conclusions beyond what's directly stated
questions.sentence: Economists _____ future unemployment rates based on current hiring trends and consumer spending patterns.

questions.definition: suggest as a basis for reasoning
questions.sentence: The physicist _____ that dark matter exists based on gravitational effects observed in distant galaxies.

questions.definition: stubbornly sticking to beliefs without considering other views
questions.sentence: The professor's _____ refusal to acknowledge new research findings frustrated many of her colleagues.
Investors remained _____ of the startup's revenue projections despite the enthusiastic pitch.
The mediator maintained an _____ stance throughout the negotiations between the union and management.

questions.definition: able to recover quickly from difficulties
questions.sentence: The community proved remarkably _____ after the hurricane, rebuilding homes and businesses within months.
The journalist's _____ investigation eventually uncovered evidence of widespread corruption in city government.
Budget cuts continued to _____ the school district's ability to provide quality education.

questions.definition: publicly declare something to be wrong or evil
questions.sentence: Religious leaders gathered to _____ the government's discriminatory policies at a press conference.
The central bank lowered interest rates to _____ consumer confidence during the recession.

questions.definition: admit that something is true after initially denying it
questions.sentence: After reviewing the data, the senator had to _____ that her opponent's economic plan had some merit.

questions.definition: make something stronger or more secure
questions.sentence: The company plans to _____ its cybersecurity systems after last month's data breach.

questions.definition: make an action or process easier
questions.sentence: The new highway system will _____ trade between the coastal cities and inland manufacturing centers.
Emergency responders worked to _____ the environmental damage caused by the chemical spill.

questions.definition: make something greater by adding to it
questions.sentence: The university decided to _____ its scholarship fund by accepting donations from alumni.
International organizations swiftly moved to _____ the military's violent suppression of peaceful protesters.

questions.definition: regard or represent as being of little worth
questions.sentence: The food critic's review seemed designed to _____ the restaurant rather than provide constructive feedback.
The detective found the suspect's _____ behavior during questioning both fascinating and frustrating.

questions.definition: imitative of someone else's work, lacking originality
questions.sentence: Critics dismissed the novel as _____, noting its obvious borrowing from several popular fantasy series.
Outdated regulations continue to _____ the development of renewable energy infrastructure.

questions.definition: block or get in the way of something
questions.sentence: Protesters gathered to _____ traffic on the main highway as part of their demonstration.

questions.definition: delay or prevent progress by creating obstacles
questions.sentence: Lack of funding threatens to _____ the medical research team's groundbreaking cancer study.

questions.definition: make a problem or bad situation worse
questions.sentence: The politician's aggressive comments served to _____ the tension between the two nations rather than resolve it.
The _____ donor preferred to remain anonymous while giving millions to the children's hospital.
The young intern was always _____ to the senior partners, listening carefully to their advice without interruption.
The auditor found several _____ errors in the accounting records that could not be dismissed as simple mistakes.

questions.definition: shock or excite someone into taking action
questions.sentence: The inspiring speech helped to _____ the community into cleaning up the neglected local park.

questions.definition: having or showing no skill; clumsy
questions.sentence: The _____ handling of the public relations crisis led to a sharp drop in the company's stock value.

questions.definition: express regret or disappointment over something
questions.sentence: Historians often _____ the loss of ancient texts that were destroyed during the burning of the library.
Human memory is surprisingly _____; it can be significantly altered by suggestion and the passage of time.

questions.definition: no longer produced or used; out of date
questions.sentence: Rapid technological advancements have made flip phones largely _____ in today's smartphone market.
Coffee shops have become _____ in the city center, with one appearing on nearly every corner.
